Dla mnie jest to druga najlepsza część z tych "jedynek". Najbardziej rozszerzona, największy dostęp do broni, jest Xen, także to, z czym walczył Gordon, a nawet jeszcze więcej. Gra wydaje się być nawet trudniejsza, by przeżyć jak dla mnie protagonista musiał poświęcić się bardziej, niż ikona serii. I tak całość się klei, aż do poznania końcówki, która niekoniecznie została zrobiona z pomysłem.Półkę wyżej jest tylko pierwsza część Half Life'a, która ma zachowany ciąg przyczynowo-skutkowy do samego końca. Niemniej jednak polecam ze względu na to, że przez bardziej urozmaiconą rozgrywkę mam do tej części największy sentyment.

Однозначно да. Это то дополнение, которое может претендовать на то, чтобы быть полноценной отдельной частью серии. Больше всего меня поразили локации - от них просто голова идёт кругом. Интересные битвы с боссами, новые интересные (хоть и слегка дизбалансные) враги. Да что уж говорить - в игре можно развлекаться только включая-выключая прибор ночного зрения, звук доставляет удовольствие. Рекомендую.
NGL it's hard, even on normal, but I still had fun.
流程短，没字幕，但光看画面也能大概猜来剧情。好玩是好玩，但是资源太少，尤其血包，我几乎全程大多数时间都是半血以下的状态。总体而言，如果你是一个半条命忠粉，这个和蓝色沸点两个资料片你是不可错过的

I find HL Opposing Force to be greatly underrated. I obviously would not compare it to the base game, but there is some very unique gameplay, very cool enemies (Race X), and some very important lore that should be considered before overlooking this game. The final boss battle with the Gene Worm and the ending were not great, which is likely why this game has received a mixed response from fans over the years. But I would still seriously recommend this game if you are a Half-Life fan, or if you're at all curious about the lore. There are some very unique gameplay features (like the alien grappling hook) and in-game events (like Freeman jumping into the xen portal in the lambda core) that I found to be very cool and unique, so no doubt it is worth checking out.

this is even better then the original half life. you get a desert eagle and a green goop shooter which are very good weapons. there are 2 worms in opposing force and 0 worms in the original half life, and i think that speaks for itself

This expansion is just amazing, it has a lot of new stuff like new weapons and mechanics, the H.E.C.U. guys are just great, their lines really enhance the situations and the gameplay is flawless. I was kinda disappointed with the final boss though, the fight itself was cool and all but it didn't feel like you were facing the final menace unlike half-life's nihilanth.

Real good classic. Has the mechanics of Half Life, but with some improvements and greater diversity in the weapon and enemy pools. Fixes quite a issues that weren't addressed in Half Life.

É simplesmente fantástico!  

Tudo bem que eu também gosto da expansão Blue Shift, e não critico a Gearbox por ter mantido as mesmas armas e inimigos do Half Life, afinal, a história se passa quase que em paralelo ao do primeiro jogo. Mas, no caso de Opposing Force, a Gearbox oube muito bem explorar o fato de que apenas depois de um tempo o protagonista recobra a consciencia. Foi muito bom ter uma diversificada nos inimigos e também nas armas disponíveis para combate.

Também achei que ficou um jogo grande, o que é ótimo, pois não ficou massante, mas sim divertido de jogar. 

Os estoques de Black Mesa são locais bem bacanas, dão um certo conforto e alívio quando nos escondemos no meio das caixas após um longo período de combate. É um jogo onde entramos na pele do personagem e não queremos mais parar de jogar, assim como toda a saga Half Life.

De las expansiones de Half-Life 1 esta es la mejor de las dos, esta te ofrece un nuevo punto de vista de la historia, puesto a que ahora veras el Incidente de Black Mesa a través de los ojos del Cabo Adrian Shephard, un miembro de las unidades especiales enviadas a contener el desastre de Black Mesa y matar a Gordon Freeman.

también hay un error que no te deja mover la cámara, para corregirlo hay que abrir los ajustes, ir al apartado del ratón y habilitar Raw mouse imput, le das a aplicar y listo, debería estar arreglado

Blue Shift must've been Gearbox just getting their toes dipped into the water: a fairly interesting modification with a short but generally fun run through a different perspective of the Black Mesa incident. Opposing Force is when they hit their stride. There are at least five new enemies, seven new weapons (well, six, one is actually a tool), and 2 new gameplay mechanics: rope climbing and night vision goggles. I was blown away by just how many new things were in this in comparison to Blue Shift. The level puzzles and general map layouts are much better as I never felt nearly as lost. The need for team mates is used a lot more, as you will use your squad mates to access new areas, and there's a lot more world building going on with all the dialogue between your commanders and squad. The only downside to the game is that the last quarter or so of the game, you will be absolutely starved for health and armor pickups/stations. I was so exhausted by the end of the game just from constantly needing to play more and more careful or I would be reloading my save. I also feel like the final boss was overly gimmicky and is rather boring, and maybe a little annoying. But overall, this expansion FEELS like an expansion, and is definitely worth every cent of $5.

adrian shepherd my beloved

In all my time of having played and replayed Half-Life this is only the second time I've played and completed Opposing Force and have to say it didn't disappoint.

I've already left a review as to why I appreciate Half-Life and why I recommend playing the vanilla version, so I won't go into much detail in this review.

Opposing Force gives the perspective of the soldiers attacking Black Mesa, which gives a lot of insight to the overall plot of the game. You also realise that there are basically 3 factions, Black Mesa, the Army and Black Ops, all have different missions. As you're playing for the army in this regard, you're quest at first is to find Freeman, which is abandoned and it becomes all about survival against the black ops and alien horde.

Although this story was never expanded, it's none the less an awesome and worth playing expansion to Half-Life. I'm not aware of any remasters like Black Mesa was for Half-Life, but this version still holds well and I recommend giving it a go.
